apiClassifier.shortdesc: TypedQueue works as a wrapper for a queue.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
TypedQueue works as a wrapper for a queue. Since ActionScript 3.0 does not support typed arrays, TypedQueue is a way to create typed queues. It stores the wrapQueue constructor's argument in the wrappedQueue variable. So every method call to this class is forwarded to the wrappedQueue object. The methods that need to be checked for the type of the elements are previously validated with the validateType or validateCollection method before forward the call. If the type of an element requested to be added to this list is incompatible with the type of the list, the method offer returns false and the method add throws org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError. The calls that are forwarded to the wrappedQueue returns the return of the wrappedQueue call.
TypedQueue does not allow null elements.
You can also create unique and typed queues. See below the link "QueueUtil.getUniqueTypedQueue()".

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new TypedQueue object.

apiException.apiDesc: if the wrapQueue argument is null.
if the type argument is null.
if the types of one or more elements in the wrapQueue argument are incompatible with the type argument.

apiParam.apiDesc: the target queue to wrap.
the type of the elements allowed by this queue.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new TypedQueue object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If the element argument is null throws ArgumentError.

apiException.apiDesc: if the element argument is null.
if the type of the element is incompatible with the type of this collection.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedCollection.add.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to forward to wrappedCollection.add.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If the element argument is null throws ArgumentError. Otherwise the element is validated with the validateType method to be forwarded to wrappedCollection.add.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new TypedQueue object with the clone of the wrappedQueue object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new TypedQueue object with the clone of the wrappedQueue object.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new TypedQueue object with the clone of the wrappedQueue object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.dequeue.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedQueue.dequeue.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.dequeue.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.element.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedQueue.element.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.element.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method first checks if other argument is a TypedQueue.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the arbitrary evaluation considers the objects equal.

apiParam.apiDesc: the object to be compared for equality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This method first checks if other argument is a TypedQueue. If not it returns false. If true it checks the type property of both queues. If they are different it returns false. Otherwise it uses CollectionUtil.equalConsideringOrder method to perform equality, sending this queue and other argument.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If isValidType(element) returns false then returns false.

apiReturn.apiDesc: false if isValidType(element) returns false. Otherwise returns the return of the call wrappedQueue.offer.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to forward to wrappedQueue.offer.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If isValidType(element) returns false then returns false. Otherwise, it forwards the call to wrappedQueue.offer.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.peek.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedQueue.peek.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.peek.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.poll.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedQueue.poll.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.poll.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: UniqueQueue works as a wrapper for a queue.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
UniqueQueue works as a wrapper for a queue. It does not allow duplicated elements in the queue. It stores the wrapQueue constructor's argument in the wrappedQueue variable. So every method call to this class is forwarded to the wrappedQueue object. The methods that need to be checked for duplication are previously validated before forward the call. The calls that are forwarded to the wrappedQueue returns the return of the wrappedQueue call.
You can also create unique and typed queues. See below the link "QueueUtil.getUniqueTypedQueue()".

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new UniqueQueue object.

apiException.apiDesc: if the wrapQueue argument is null.

apiParam.apiDesc: the target queue to wrap.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new UniqueQueue object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions.

apiException.apiDesc: if the specified element is null.
if the class of the specified element prevents it from being added to this queue.
if wrappedQueue.contains(element) returns true.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if this queue changed as a result of the call.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to be added.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions. This method differs from offer only in that it throws an error if the element cannot be inserted.
This implementation returns the result of offer unless the element cannot be inserted.
If wrappedQueue.contains(element) returns true an IllegalOperationError is thrown.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new UniqueQueue object with the clone of the wrappedQueue object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new UniqueQueue object with the clone of the wrappedQueue object.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new UniqueQueue object with the clone of the wrappedQueue object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.dequeue.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedQueue.dequeue.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.dequeue.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.element.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedQueue.element.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.element.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method uses CollectionUtil.equalConsideringOrder method to perform equality, sending this list and other argument.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the arbitrary evaluation considers the objects equal.

apiParam.apiDesc: the object to be compared for equality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This method uses CollectionUtil.equalConsideringOrder method to perform equality, sending this list and other argument.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If wrappedQueue.contains(element) returns true then returns false.

apiReturn.apiDesc: false if wrappedQueue.contains(element) returns true. Otherwise returns the return of the call wrappedQueue.offer.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to forward to wrappedQueue.offer.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If wrappedQueue.contains(element) returns true then returns false. Otherwise, it forwards the call to wrappedQueue.offer.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.peek.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedQueue.peek.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.peek.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.poll.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the return of the call wrappedQueue.poll.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Forwards the call to wrappedQueue.poll.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This queue uses a org.as3coreaddendum.system.comparators.PriorityComparator object to sort the elements.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
This queue uses a org.as3coreaddendum.system.comparators.PriorityComparator object to sort the elements. All elements must implement the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority interface, otherwise a org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError is thrown.
This queue also adds an event listener on elements to org.as3coreaddendum.events.PriorityEvent (if elements implement flash.events.IEventDispatcher). Thus this queue keeps itself automatically sorted if its elements dispatch a org.as3coreaddendum.events.PriorityEvent when its priority changes.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new PriorityQueue object.

apiException.apiDesc: if one or more elements in the source argument do not implement the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority interface.

apiParam.apiDesc: an array to fill the queue.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new PriorityQueue object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions.

apiException.apiDesc: if the specified element is null.
if the element does not implements the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority interface.
if the specified element cannot be inserted.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if this queue changed as a result of the call.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions. This method differs from offer only in that it throws an error if the element cannot be inserted.
This implementation returns the result of offer unless the element cannot be inserted.
This implementation only allow elements that implements the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority interface. A org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError is thrown if the element does not implements this interface.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new PriorityQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new PriorityQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new PriorityQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the element was added to this queue, else false.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to add.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions. When using a restricted queue (like TypedQueue and UniqueQueue), this method is generally preferable to add, which can fail to insert an element only by throwing an error.
This implementation only allow elements that implements the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority interface. If the element does not implements this interface the method returns false.
Before returning, the queue is reordered.

apiValue.shortdesc: PriorityQueue does not allow changing its comparator object.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
PriorityQueue does not allow changing its comparator object.
PriorityQueue was designed to be used exclusively with its default comparator object. If you want to change the comparator object using this setter, consider using SortedQueue class instead.
If this setter is used an IllegalOperationError is thrown.

apiValue.shortdesc: PriorityQueue does not allow changing its options.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
PriorityQueue does not allow changing its options.
PriorityQueue was designed to be used exclusively with its default options. If you want to change the options using this setter, consider using SortedQueue class instead.
If this setter is used an IllegalOperationError is thrown.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: LinearQueue orders elements in a FIFO (first-in-first-out) manner.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
LinearQueue orders elements in a FIFO (first-in-first-out) manner.
LinearQueue does not allow null elements.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3collections.IQueue; import org.as3collections.queues.LinearQueue;
var queue:IQueue = new LinearQueue();
queue // [] queue.size() // 0 queue.isEmpty() // true
queue.peek() // null queue.element() // NoSuchElementError: The queue is empty.
queue.offer(3) // true queue // [3] queue.size() // 1 queue.isEmpty() // false
queue.offer("a") // true queue // [3,a]
queue.offer(1) // true queue // [3,a,1]
queue.offer(7) // true queue // [3,a,1,7]
queue.offer(null) // false queue.add(null) // ArgumentError: The 'element' argument must not be 'null'. queue // [3,a,1,7]
queue.peek() // 3 queue.element() // 3 queue: // [3,a,1,7]
queue.poll() // 3 queue // [a,1,7]
queue.dequeue() // a queue // [1,7]
queue.remove(10) // false queue // [1,7]
queue.remove(7) // true queue // [1]
queue.clear() queue // [] queue.size() // 0 queue.isEmpty() // true
queue.poll() // null queue.dequeue() // NoSuchElementError: The queue is empty.

import org.as3collections.IQueue; import org.as3collections.queues.LinearQueue;
var queue1:IQueue = new LinearQueue([1, 5, 3, 7]);
queue1 // [1,5,3,7] queue1.size() // 4 queue1.isEmpty() // false
var queue2:IQueue = queue1.clone();
queue2 // [1,5,3,7] queue2.size() // 4 queue2.isEmpty() // false
queue2.equals(queue1) // true queue1.equals(queue2) // true
queue2.poll() // 1 queue2 // [5,3,7]
queue2.equals(queue1) // false queue1.equals(queue2) // false queue2.equals(queue2) // true
queue1.clear() queue1 // []
queue2.clear() queue2: // []
queue2.equals(queue1) // true

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new LinearQueue object.

apiParam.apiDesc: an array to fill the queue.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new LinearQueue object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes all of the elements from this queue.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes all of the elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this method returns.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new LinearQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new LinearQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new LinearQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns an iterator over a set of elements.

apiReturn.apiDesc: an iterator over a set of elements.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns an iterator over a set of elements.
This implementation returns an ArrayIterator object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the element was added to this queue, else false.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to add.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions. When using a restricted queue (like TypedQueue and UniqueQueue), this method is generally preferable to add, which can fail to insert an element only by throwing an error.
This implementation adds the element to the tail of the queue.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Retrieves, but does not remove, the head of this queue, or returns null if this queue is empty.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the head of this queue, or null if this queue is empty.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Retrieves, but does not remove, the head of this queue, or returns null if this queue is empty.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Retrieves and removes the head of this queue, or returns null if this queue is empty.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the head of this queue, or null if this queue is empty.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Retrieves and removes the head of this queue, or returns null if this queue is empty.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This queue uses a org.as3coreaddendum.system.comparators.IndexComparator object to sort the elements.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
This queue uses a org.as3coreaddendum.system.comparators.IndexComparator object to sort the elements. All elements must implement the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interface, otherwise a org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError is thrown.
This queue also adds an event listener on elements to org.as3coreaddendum.events.IndexEvent (if elements implement flash.events.IEventDispatcher). Thus this queue keeps itself automatically sorted if its elements dispatch a org.as3coreaddendum.events.IndexEvent when its index changes.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new IndexQueue object.

apiException.apiDesc: if one or more elements in the source argument do not implement the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interface.

apiParam.apiDesc: an array to fill the queue.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new IndexQueue object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions.

apiException.apiDesc: if the specified element is null.
if the element does not implements the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interface.
if the specified element cannot be inserted.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if this queue changed as a result of the call.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions. This method differs from offer only in that it throws an error if the element cannot be inserted.
This implementation returns the result of offer unless the element cannot be inserted.
This implementation only allow elements that implements the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interface. A org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError is thrown if the element does not implements this interface.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new IndexQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new IndexQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new IndexQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the element was added to this queue, else false.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to add.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions. When using a restricted queue (like TypedQueue and UniqueQueue), this method is generally preferable to add, which can fail to insert an element only by throwing an error.
This implementation only allow elements that implements the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interface. If the element does not implements this interface the method returns false.
Before returning, the queue is reordered.

apiValue.shortdesc: IndexQueue does not allow changing its comparator object.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
IndexQueue does not allow changing its comparator object.
IndexQueue was designed to be used exclusively with its default comparator object. If you want to change the comparator object using this setter, consider using SortedQueue class instead.
If this setter is used an IllegalOperationError is thrown.

apiValue.shortdesc: IndexQueue does not allow changing its options.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
IndexQueue does not allow changing its options.
IndexQueue was designed to be used exclusively with its default options. If you want to change the options using this setter, consider using SortedQueue class instead.
If this setter is used an IllegalOperationError is thrown.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This queue uses an org.as3coreaddendum.system.comparators.PriorityIndexComparator object to sort the elements.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
This queue uses an org.as3coreaddendum.system.comparators.PriorityIndexComparator object to sort the elements. All elements must implement the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority and org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interfaces, otherwise a org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError is thrown.
This queue is useful when you want to sort the objects by priority, but if the priority of two objects are equal, the index property of the objects are compared to decide wich object comes before.
This queue also adds an event listener on elements to org.as3coreaddendum.events.PriorityEvent and org.as3coreaddendum.events.IndexEvent (if elements implement flash.events.IEventDispatcher). Thus this queue keeps itself automatically sorted if its elements dispatch a org.as3coreaddendum.events.PriorityEvent or org.as3coreaddendum.events.IndexEvent when its priority or index changes.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new IndexablePriorityQueue object.

apiException.apiDesc: if one or more elements in the source argument do not implement the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority and org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interfaces.

apiParam.apiDesc: an array to fill the queue.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new IndexablePriorityQueue object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions.

apiException.apiDesc: if the specified element is null.
if the element does not implements the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority or org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interfaces.
if the specified element cannot be inserted.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if this queue changed as a result of the call.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions. This method differs from offer only in that it throws an error if the element cannot be inserted.
This implementation returns the result of offer unless the element cannot be inserted.
This implementation only allow elements that implements the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority and org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interfaces. A org.as3coreaddendum.errors.ClassCastError is thrown if the element does not implements this interfaces.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new IndexablePriorityQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new IndexablePriorityQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new IndexablePriorityQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the element was added to this queue, else false.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to add.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions. When using a restricted queue (like TypedQueue and UniqueQueue), this method is generally preferable to add, which can fail to insert an element only by throwing an error.
This implementation only allow elements that implements the org.as3coreaddendum.system.IPriority and org.as3coreaddendum.system.IIndexable interfaces. If the element does not implements this interfaces the method returns false.
Before returning, the queue is reordered.

apiValue.shortdesc: IndexablePriorityQueue does not allow changing its comparator object.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
IndexablePriorityQueue does not allow changing its comparator object.
IndexablePriorityQueue was designed to be used exclusively with its default comparator object. If you want to change the comparator object using this setter, consider using SortedQueue class instead.
If this setter is used an IllegalOperationError is thrown.

apiValue.shortdesc: IndexablePriorityQueue does not allow changing its options.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
IndexablePriorityQueue does not allow changing its options.
IndexablePriorityQueue was designed to be used exclusively with its default options. If you want to change the options using this setter, consider using SortedQueue class instead.
If this setter is used an IllegalOperationError is thrown.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A queue that provides a total ordering on its elements.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
A queue that provides a total ordering on its elements. The queue is ordered according to the natural ordering of its elements, by a IComparator typically provided at sorted queue creation time, or by the arguments provided to the sort or sortOn methods.
For each change that occurs the queue is automatically ordered using the comparator and options. If none was provided the default behavior of the sort method is used.
The user of this queue may change their order at any time by calling the sort or sortOn method and imposing others arguments to change the sort behaviour.
It's possible to create unique sorted queues, typed sorted queues and even unique typed sorted queues. You just sends the SortedQueue object to the wrappers UniqueQueue or TypedQueue or uses the QueueUtil.getUniqueTypedQueue. But there's a problem here: the return type will be UniqueQueue or TypedQueue. Thus you will can no longer use the sort and sortOn methods directly. The wrapped SortedQueue will be only automatically ordered, with the provided comparator and options constructor's arguments. Check the examples at the bottom of the page.

example.codeblock:
import org.as3collections.ISortedQueue; import org.as3collections.queues.SortedQueue;
var queue1:ISortedQueue = new SortedQueue([3, 5, 1, 7], null, Array.NUMERIC | Array.DESCENDING);
queue1 // [7,5,3,1] queue1.size() // 4
queue1.add(-1) // true queue1 // [7,5,3,1,-1] queue1.size() // 5
queue1.add(4) // true queue1 // [7,5,4,3,1,-1] queue1.size() // 6
queue1.add(5) // true queue1 // [7,5,5,4,3,1,-1] queue1.size() // 7
queue1.poll() // 7 queue1 // [5,5,4,3,1,-1] queue1.size() // 6
queue1.sort(null, Array.NUMERIC) queue1 // [-1,1,3,4,5,5]
queue1.poll() // -1 queue1 // [5,5,4,3,1] queue1.size() // 5
queue1.add(2) // true queue1 // [5,5,4,3,2,1] queue1.size() // 6
queue1.add(10) // true queue1 // [10,5,5,4,3,2,1]

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Constructor, creates a new SortedQueue object.

apiParam.apiDesc: an array to fill the queue.
the comparator object to be used internally to sort.
the options to be used internally to sort.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc: Constructor, creates a new SortedQueue object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates and return a new SortedQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiReturn.apiDesc: a new SortedQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates and return a new SortedQueue object containing all elements in this queue (in the same order).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Performs an arbitrary, specific evaluation of equality between this object and the other object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the arbitrary evaluation considers the objects equal.

apiParam.apiDesc: the object to be compared for equality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Performs an arbitrary, specific evaluation of equality between this object and the other object.
This implementation considers two differente objects equal if:
object A and object B are instances of the same class (i.e. if they have exactly the same type)
object A contains all elements of object B
object B contains all elements of object A
elements have exactly the same order
object A and object B has the same type of comparator
object A and object B has the same options
This implementation takes care of the order of the elements in the queue. So, for two queues are equal the order of elements returned by the iterator object must be equal.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the element was added to this queue, else false.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to add.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts the specified element into this queue if it is possible to do so immediately without violating restrictions. When using a restricted queue (like TypedQueue and UniqueQueue), this method is generally preferable to add, which can fail to insert an element only by throwing an error.
Before returning, the queue is reordered.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Retrieves and removes the head of this queue, or returns null if this queue is empty.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the head of this queue, or null if this queue is empty.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Retrieves and removes the head of this queue, or returns null if this queue is empty.
Before returning, the queue is reordered.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes all of this queue's elements that are also contained in the specified collection.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if this queue changed as a result of the call.

apiParam.apiDesc: the collection containing elements to be removed from this queue.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Removes all of this queue's elements that are also contained in the specified collection. After this call returns, this queue will contain no elements in common with the specified collection.
Before returning, the queue is reordered.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes a single instance (only one occurrence) of the specified object from this queue, if it is present.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if an object was removed as a result of this call.

apiParam.apiDesc: the object to be removed from this collection, if present.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Removes a single instance (only one occurrence) of the specified object from this queue, if it is present.
Before returning, the queue is reordered.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sorts the elements in an array according to one or more fields in the array.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Sorts the elements in an array according to one or more fields in the array.
Consult Array.sortOn in the ActionScript 3.0 Language Reference in the link below for more info.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sorts the objects within this class.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Sorts the objects within this class.
For more info see org.as3coreaddendum.system.ISortable.sort() in the link below.

apiValue.shortdesc: Defines the comparator object to be used automatically to sort.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Defines the comparator object to be used automatically to sort.
If this value change the queue is automatically reordered with the new value.

apiValue.shortdesc: Defines the options to be used automatically to sort.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Defines the options to be used automatically to sort.
If this value change the queue is automatically reordered with the new value.
